description: This file defines functions for making HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) to a REST API, wrapping around the fetch API. It builds URLs from a base URL environment variable and handles JSON data, errors, and authorization tokens.
external_files: node: fetch API (built-in or polyfill in the environment)

methods.name: buildUrl(path)
methods.description: Constructs a full URL from the provided endpoint path, using the base URL from environment variables.

methods.name: request(path, { method = "GET", body, token, headers = {} } = {})
methods.description: A generic asynchronous function that performs an HTTP request with error handling, supporting different HTTP methods and JSON payloads.

methods.name: apiGet(path, token, headers)
methods.description: Performs a GET request to the API at the specified path, optionally including a token and extra headers.

methods.name: apiPost(path, body, token, headers)
methods.description: Performs a POST request to the API at the specified path with a JSON body, optionally including a token and extra headers.

methods.name: apiPut(path, body, token, headers)
methods.description: Performs a PUT request to the API at the specified path with a JSON body, optionally including a token and extra headers.

methods.name: apiDelete(path, token, headers)
methods.description: Performs a DELETE request to the API at the specified path, optionally including a token and extra headers.

ctags.name: apiPost
ctags.pattern: /^export async function apiPost(path, body, token, headers) {$/

ctags.name: apiPut
ctags.pattern: /^export async function apiPut(path, body, token, headers) {$/

ctags.name: request
ctags.pattern: /^async function request(path, { method = "GET", body, token, headers = {} } = {}) {$/
